statement: wisconsin is on pace to double the number of layoffs this year

statement: over the past five years the federal government has paid out million in retirement and disability benefits to deceased former federal employees

speaker: brendan-doherty
justification: rhode islands former top cop is setting his bar of expectation pretty high if hes promising to curb this kind of rampant fraud and waste get updates from politifactri on twitter

statement: says that tennessee law requires that schools receive half of proceeds million per year from a half cent increase in the shelby county sales tax
subject: county-budget,county-government,education,taxes
speaker: stand-children-tennessee
justification: residents in those suburbs do not get a vote because they already have authorized sales tax increases for their towns another argument by proponents is that a vote against the half cent sales tax increase is essentially a vote for a property tax increase to fund the expected budget gap created because of schools consolidation our ruling there is clearly much for voters to consider on the referendum to increase by a half cent the county s sales tax rate and the contentiousness related to the shelby county s reorganization of public schools has created some confusion for voters

statement: says vice president joe biden admits that the american people are being scammed with the economic stimulus package

statement: we know that more than half of hillary clintons meetings while she was secretary of state were given to major contributors to the clinton foundation

statement: we know there are more democrats in georgia than republicans we know that for a fact

statement: politifact texas says congressman edwards attacks on bill flores are false

statement: says percent of federal spending goes to the military and just percent goes to food and agriculture including food stamps

statement: ronald reagan faced an even worse recession than the current one
subject: economy,history
speaker: sarah-palin
justification: the misery index in the current recession has been lower in and so far in the barometers we examined aren t necessarily equal measurements of the magnitude but collectively they paint a picture that the current recession so far is worse than the one under reagan even if we had decided to include inflation as a factor the measurements would still indicate the current recession is worse

statement: there have not been any public safety issues in cities that allow transgender people to use the bathroom of the gender they identify as

statement: the number of illegal immigrants could be million it could be million
subject: immigration
speaker: donald-trump
justification: trump said the number of illegal immigrants could be million it could be million both figures are not within the range of possibility every credible estimate we found was in the million range with a margin of error of around million the figure has always been million in recent years because of the flow of undocumented immigrants in and out of the united states

statement: marijuana is less toxic than alcohol
subject: drugs,health-care,marijuana
speaker: marijuana-policy-project
justification: our job as fact checkers in this case is not to decide whether marijuana is good or harmful we re focused on whether the drug in its natural form is less toxic than alcohol in that regard science and statistics present a strong case deaths or even trips to the hospital are much more likely due to alcohol scientists could not find any documented deaths from smoking marijuana a study found the safety ratio for marijuana the number of doses to cause death is much greater than compared to alcohol put another way marijuana is times less toxic than alcohol

statement: says charlie crist is embroiled in a fraud case for steering taxpayer money to a de facto ponzi scheme

statement: now there was a time when someone like scalia and ginsburg got plus votes

statement: contends that president obama literally said if his cap and trade proposals were to pass that utility rates his words now would necessarily skyrocket

statement: the united states has a low voter turnout rate

statement: says thomas jefferson said you might be able to fool the people for awhile and they may go astray but sooner or later the american people are going to wake up and they will correct the course
subject: health-care,history
speaker: herman-cain
justification: cain said that thomas jefferson said you might be able to fool the people for a while and they may go astray but sooner or later the american people are going to wake up and they will correct the course jefferson did write a line that resembles that in some important ways but cain put a fair number of words into jeffersons mouth at punditfact we believe quotations should be relatively word for word accurate if someone went to the trouble to leave their thoughts for posterity the least we should do is honor what they actually said

statement: because of the federal health care law health plans canceled in florida

speaker: rick-scott
context: a television ad from Let's Get to Work
justification: scott s tv ad says health plans canceled attributing the number to news reports last fall florida blue started sending letters to members stating that their plans didnt comply with obamacare and would be canceled however the ad omits key information here members were offered new plans that complied with the law obama later announced that people could keep their plans for another year and most of the florida blue members have kept their pre obamacare plans for now

statement: in massachusetts scott brown pushed for a law to force women considering abortion force them to look at color photographs of developing fetuses
subject: abortion,legal-issues,women
speaker: jeanne-shaheen
justification: shaheens ad says that in massachusetts scott brown pushed for a law to force women considering abortion force them to look at color photographs of developing fetuses the measure backed by brown nine years ago made sure that women were provided photos of developing fetuses along with a lot more information it certainly forced doctors and their representatives to provide this information to women seeking abortions except in cases of emergency and it ensured women received the information both through verbal questions and a signed consent form brown has a point that the bill wouldn t have forced them to look at color photographs but it did just about everything else it could possibly do up to that line

statement: the fed created trillion out of nothing gave it to banks and some of them foreign banks so that they could stabilize their operations
subject: economy,financial-regulation
speaker: dennis-kucinich
justification: two of the several foreign banks getting help were royal bank of scotland plc at billion and ubs ag of switzerland at billion the federal reserve treats foreign banks operating in the united states the same as u s banks because they are all part of the same financial system on a side note even some companies including general electric received emergency cash so while kucinichs comment that the fed created trillion out of nothing gave it to banks and some of them foreign banks so that they could stabilize their operations is a bit flip maybe even pejorative he was essentially correct in describing the unique money creating capabilities of the federal reserve and how it was used

statement: texas families have kept more than billion in their family budgets since we successfully fought to restore texas sales tax deduction a decade ago
subject: states,taxes
speaker: kevin-brady
justification: brady said texas families have kept more than billion in their family budgets since we successfully fought to restore texas sales tax deduction a decade ago while thats a squishy figure an estimate that cant be pinned as a fact unless you somehow divine every texans marginal tax rate for each of the years for starters it appears to be reasonable its also so that families that had these savings were mostly better off lower income taxpayers tend not to itemize deductions

statement: pre existing conditions are covered under my health care plan
subject: debates,health-care
speaker: mitt-romney
justification: romney said his health care proposals include protections for pre existing conditions what he didnt say at the debate but which his website states and advisers confirmed after the debate is that people would be protected from denial only if they have been continuously insured the health care law though offers protections whether people have current coverage or not so it offers more robust protection the law also includes a requirement that everyone have insurance or pay a tax penalty romneys plan doesnt have that requirement romney did not mention the qualifier that people have to stay insured to get the protection

statement: greg abbott activated the state guard to monitor jade helm in case the troops try to impose martial law disarm innocent texans and detain them in tunnels beneath closed walmart stores
subject: military,states
speaker: doonesbury
context: the strip about Greg Abbott and the Jade Helm military exercise
justification: bernie a doonesbury character said abbott activated the state guard to monitor jade helm in case the troops try to impose martial law disarm innocent texans and detain them in tunnels beneath closed walmart stores abbott told the guard to monitor the exercise though far as we can tell no troops were dispatched or activated its also worth noting abbott has said texans safety and rights were not threatened by the federal maneuvers

statement: says he won the second debate with hillary clinton in a landslide in every poll
subject: debates,elections,polls
speaker: donald-trump
justification: for what theyre worth those are landslide margins but even in non scientific surveys trump didnt win them all in a non scientific survey done online by the fox television affiliate in milwaukee clinton won by percent to percent among votes cast but four national scientific surveys all showed that not only did trump not win by a landslide margin he didnt win any of the polls at all

statement: says bag litter increased after san francisco banned single use shopping bags
subject: environment
speaker: drew-springer
justification: springer said san franciscos litter from bags actually increased after enacting their ban on plastic bags a litter audit conducted before the ban took full effect found two more retail plastic bags than the previous years sampling however the next audit launched after the ban had been fully in place for nearly a year saw a two bag drop maybe this means that such litter is decreasing though we would want more research to reach definitive conclusions

statement: in newt gingrich first advocated for the individual mandate in health care and as recently as may of this year he was still advocating for it
subject: health-care
speaker: michele-bachmann
context: a Republican presidential debate in Des Moines, Iowa
justification: in the interview gingrich advocated for individuals being required to have health insurance though he expressed flexibility on the details in the interview gingrich said we ought to have some requirement that you either have health insurance or you post a bond its an exaggeration to say that this equates to advocating for an individual mandate since he posed it as one of two acceptable options

statement: says as a result of the national health care reform the congressional budget office says we save million over the first years over the next years we save trillion in savings in terms of health care
subject: health-care
speaker: robert-menendez
context: an interview on Richard French Live
justification: over the next years we save trillion in savings in terms of health care but menendez fumbled by citing those specific figures over the first years the budget office is projecting a reduction of billion not the million cited by menendez as for whether there will be trillion in savings in the second years the budget office has not projected any specific dollar figure for that period

statement: you said you would vote against the patriot act then you came to the senate you voted for it
subject: terrorism
speaker: hillary-clinton
justification: clinton was also among those senators voting yes obama said the final deal was not ideal but was an improvement over earlier republican proposals this compromise does modestly improve the patriot act by strengthening civil liberties protections without sacrificing the tools that law enforcement needs to keep us safe he said adding i urge my colleagues to continue working on ways to improve the civil liberties protections in the patriot act after it is reauthorized so while obama did vote to reauthorize the patriot act he did so after working to improve the law by expanding civil rights guarantees

statement: the federal minimum wage is worth about percent less than it was when ronald reagan gave his first address to a joint session of congress
subject: economy,history,income,workers
speaker: barack-obama
context: the State of the Union address
justification: obama said the federal minimum wage is worth about twenty percent less than it was when ronald reagan gave his first state of the union address obama s not far off but its actually closer to percent less and using reagan to make a case to raise the minimum wage should be taken with a grain of salt since the former president never increased it during his two terms and by reagans last state of the union the minimum wage was less than when he first took office if you factor in inflation we had written that obama had said the federal minimum wage is worth about percent less than it was when ronald reagan gave his first state of the union address as the reader pointed out a new president s first address to a joint session of congress the speech that obama was referring to is not officially called a state of the union address so we have rewritten our paraphrase in the ruling statement above to remove the reference to the state of the union

statement: a proposed tax to fund transportation projects would spend to take a single vehicle off the road during the morning and afternoon commute
subject: transportation
speaker: steve-brown
context: a forum hosted by The Atlanta Journal-Constitution
justification: in sum brown based his calculation on a transit cost estimate thats open to accusations of cherry picking furthermore even brown and ross think their own number falls short

statement: a salesclerk at hobby lobby who needs contraception is not going to get that service through her employers health care plan because her employer doesnt think she should be using contraception
subject: abortion,health-care,legal-issues,women
speaker: hillary-clinton
context: an interview at the Aspen Ideas Festival
justification: clinton said that a salesclerk at hobby lobby who needs contraception is not going to get that service through her employers health care plan because her employer doesnt think she should be using contraception hobby lobby doesnt shun contraception entirely for its employees it pays for access to out of the fdas approved methods where clinton has a partial point is that an employee would be barred from having the company pay for four other types even if one of those may be the best medical option for the employees needs update july after this article was published hillary clinton s camp got back to us a spokesman pointed us to a line from ginsberg s dissent that seems to be pretty in line with clinton s comments the exemption sought by hobby lobby and conestoga wood specialties another plaintiff in the case would override significant interests of the corporations employees and covered dependents it would deny legions of women who do not hold their employers beliefs access to contraceptive coverage that the aca would otherwise secure

statement: says charlie crist voted against raising the minimum wage
subject: economy,jobs
speaker: republican-party-florida
justification: the republican party of florida said crist voted against raising the minimum wage we should note that the vote in question was not the kind of vote people would usually think of when it comes to the minimum wage crist has never voted on legislation about the minimum wage in any official capacity but crist was at a meeting of a business advocacy group and there was a unanimous voice vote expressing the organizations opinion against raising the minimum wage crist was at the meeting but none of the votes were recorded

statement: hillary clinton said gun confiscation would be worth considering
subject: guns
speaker: national-rifle-association
justification: the nra says that when clinton was asked about gun confiscation she said i think it would be worth doing it on a national level if that can be arranged clinton made that statement last year at a new hampshire campaign stop when she was asked a vague question about an australian program that gave gun owners one year to sell certain firearms to the government before those weapons became illegal she left the nra some room but the nra stretches her words to an almost unrecognizable form clinton focused her comments on voluntary buyback programs similar to those some u s communities have instituted for guns and the federal cash for clunkers program she was ambiguous about how a u s guns buyback program might be structured saying i dont know enough details to tell you how we would do it or how it would work and her campaign since has said she opposes gun confiscation

statement: already a prototype driverless car has traveled more than miles in the crowded maze of california streets without a single accident
subject: consumer-safety,public-safety,technology,transportation
speaker: jeb-bush
justification: during his cpac speech bush talked about technological innovations underway and that will occur over the next years already a prototype driverless car has traveled more than miles in the crowded maze of california streets without a single accident bush said we dont fault bush for citing the figure rather than the recent figure because that higher number only received publicity after the cpac speech we found two accidents but they both had mitigating factors one car was rear ended which suggests another driver was at fault in another accident a human was operating the car at least according to google still we couldnt find one incident where a driverless car operating under its own technology clearly caused an accident

statement: last year out of the in population growth we had in the state of texas about of the came to texas from the other states
subject: economy,immigration
speaker: david-dewhurst
justification: first the census data for hasnt been released yet and the most generous census estimate prior to last year indicates net migration from other states equaled people from july to july accounting for less than a third of the states population increase in the period however looking at texas population growth in terms of people moving here with their feet versus people born here dewhurst pegged the ratio correctly about half and half

statement: when undocumented children are picked up at the border and told to appear later in court percent do not then show up

speaker: jeff-flake
context: an interview on the PBS "News Hour"
justification: flake said that when undocumented children are picked up at the border and told to appear later in court percent do not then show up historically the rate has ranged between percent to percent settling in at about percent in the most recent full year for which data is available a more recent estimate for children specifically made by the director of the office responsible for handling such cases is that the current no show rate for children is percent thats still quite high but its only half what flake said

statement: says gov chris christie cut spending by billion and provided million in new education funding
subject: education,state-budget
speaker: committee-our-childrens-future
justification: given the cuts made last year education funding has gone up by a total of about million since christies first budget in office

statement: hes the only candidate whos balanced budgets and brought jobs to providence

justification: he said he voted in favor of the tax benefits that lured the gtech headquarters to the capital city he also supported a variety of ordinances needed for development of the rhode island convention center finally he told us he added a handful of jobs to the providence city council office

statement: studies have shown that in the absence of federal reproductive health funds we are going to see the level of abortion in georgia increase by about percent
subject: abortion

context: an article published in The Atlanta Journal-Constitution
justification: in fact he cited a single study from a widely respected group while scholars have found that in general increases in the use of contraceptives lead to decreases in abortion and one expert said guttmacher may have underestimated its georgia figures we found no other study that confirms or refutes its conclusions about this state johnson would have been right if he said that studies show contraception decreases abortion and that without title x funds abortions could rise

statement: sixty percent of the hispanics support the arizona immigration law
