statement: if the sequester hits federal prosecutors will have to let criminals go
subject: crime,criminal-justice,federal-budget,legal-issues
speaker: barack-obama
justification: obama said that if the sequester hits federal prosecutors will have to close cases and let criminals go its clear that u s attorneys offices are looking at a potential cut of million and a reduction of that size would almost certainly cut back on prosecutions in some fashion however the impacts are not as clear cut as obamas bold language suggests officials will have a fair amount of discretion in prioritizing what types of cases prosecutors will pursue possibly cutting back on civil cases rather than criminal ones and the cuts taking place in u s attorney s offices wouldn t directly affect criminals at all but rather suspects and targets of prosecution who haven t had their guilt determined yet

statement: says dick cheney de baathisized the iraqi government and created isis
subject: foreign-policy,iraq,terrorism
speaker: chris-matthews
justification: matthews said cheney de baathisized the iraqi government and created isis we find that cheney played a key role in de baathification and in creating the circumstances thatled to the formation of isis former baathists provide important military isis leadership as they did in the first few years after the invasion when they joined forces with the group that preceded isis al qaida in iraq however many of those same baathists later turned against al qaida in iraq they shifted back into the orbit of what became isis due to the repressive policies under iraqi prime minister maliki the causal link is too distant to say cheney created isis his decisions contributed to the groups formation but not more than that

statement: says bill and hillary clinton attended donald trumps last wedding
subject: candidates-biography
speaker: carlos-curbelo
justification: curbelo said bill and hillary clinton were at donald trump s last wedding bill clinton only made the reception but hillary clinton did have a seat in the first row at the church in both rubbed elbows with the stars at the reception

statement: i did not play any role in bringing the company to ri as did others in government i was tasked with handling the legislation affecting the company by my superiors
subject: bankruptcy,debt
speaker: steven-costantino
justification: in his defense costantino issued a statement in which he said i did not play any role in bringing the company to ri as did others in government i was tasked with handling the legislation affecting the company by my superiors in other words dont blame me i was just doing my job but the records and comments of people involved illustrate that costantino played a key part in rhode island s courtship of studios the legislation he helped pass offering valuable loan guarantees was his idea according to one former edc official during the process costantino shielded his idea from the type of full political scrutiny that might have killed it he did this by not naming studios on the house floor when he was asked who was pushing for the loan guarantee program when the deal was done the ceo of schilling s company thanked all members of the general assembly and singled out five elected officials by name including the former house finance committee chairman costantino played a pivotal role in creating the studios mess in some ways the record shows he bears as much responsibility as the other elected government officials who tasked him

statement: obamacare insurance cooperative failures should be expected because theyre like any business and when you start businesses in america at the fifth year half of the businesses have closed
subject: health-care
speaker: ezekiel-emanuel
job: Vice Provost for Global Initiatives and chair of the Department of Medical Ethics and Health Policy
context: a discussion on MSNBC's "Up with Steve Kornacki"
justification: emanuel said the obamacare insurance co ops failed at a rate thats typical for american businesses over a five year period the underlying comparison is flawed while the age of each co op is subject to debate we used the census bureaus definition to determine when they were born interviews with experts government audits and regulators actions point to three years as the typical lifespan of a failed co op about percent of the co ops shut down compared to the three year failure rate in america the co ops have done much worse cratering at a rate that is about percent faster than average but emanuel could turn out to be right we wont know the five year rate for the entire group until late in or early if the remaining co ops are still running then the groups failure rate will be close to the national average emanuels statement is accurate regarding the five year average but leaves out important details

statement: the tax cut deal is giving billion to millionaires and billionaires
subject: deficit,economy,taxes
speaker: sherrod-brown
justification: yet by the time brown appeared on cnn three days after the administration announced the compromise the deal was for two years and it was that very deal that brown went on the air to criticize even if the deal had been for years brown misapplied the cost figure by describing the whole billion as going to millionaires and billionaires joint committee projections from earlier this year estimated that cost would be more like billion over years those are two key points on which browns statement simply is not accurate

statement: says marco rubio said social security and medicare haveweakened us as a people
subject: medicare,social-security
speaker: patrick-murphy
justification: murphy said that rubio said social security and medicare have weakened us as a people he said in a speech in rubio talked about government programs intended to help people and said these programs actually weakened us as a people rubio argued that people no longer had to worry about saving once they viewed it as the governments job and that the government supplanted the role of families and religious institutions to help people in need

statement: across the country billion of the recovery act have been committed in its first days
subject: economy,federal-budget,stimulus
speaker: joe-biden
justification: he said that billion had been committed at the day mark federal records show he was a little off the administration s recovery gov site shows that billion had been committed

statement: as secretary of the department of energy under former president bill clinton i created reserves of home heating oil
subject: energy
speaker: bill-richardson
justification: none came close to today s price did that reserve lower prices that s unclear since the reserve remains today even though as richardson himself points out heating oil prices in new hampshire are the highest ever

statement: twenty five states have lower unemployment than texas which is tied with mississippi for more minimum wage jobs than anywhere in the united states
subject: job-accomplishments,jobs
speaker: lloyd-doggett
job: Texas congressman in the U.S. Houst of Representatives
justification: washington which has a state minimum wage rate higher than the federal rate had the lowest share of hourly workers paid at or below minimum wage percent in sheer numbers texas had hourly workers earning minimum wage and paid below the minimum wage the bureau says the most of any state by a wide margin almost percent of the nations hourly workers paid at or below the minimum wage were in texas the second most populous state with more than million residents or about percent of the nations population according to the u s census bureau mississippi with almost million residents had and hourly workers respectively earning the minimum wage or less

statement: of the bills rep david cicilline has sponsored in his three years in office not a single one has advanced past the embryonic committee stage
subject: bipartisanship,congress,congressional-rules,job-accomplishments,voting-record
speaker: ian-prior
job: Northeast regional spokesman, National Republican Congressional Committee
justification: ian prior said of the bills rep david cicilline has sponsored in his three years in office not a single one has advanced past the embryonic committee stage in addition of the amendments cicilline offered passed priors point is that legislators in a minority party have no influence

statement: says donald trump has said he loves war including with nukes
subject: candidates-biography,foreign-policy,military
speaker: priorities-usa-action
context: an ad discussed on "Meet the Press"
justification: an ad by priorities usa says trump says he loves war including with nukes trump did say the phrase i love war in a certain way and trump has said he wouldn t rule out using nuclear weapons but that doesnt mean he is enthusiastic about them he says they would be the weapon of last resort and that he believes nuclear proliferation to be the biggest problem to me in the world it s worth noting that the trump comment used in the ad wasnt about the united states using nuclear weapons but about his belief that japan might be better off if it had nuclear weapons readers can decide for themselves if trumps positions are dangerous

statement: any state tax law has to start in the house and the renewal of the state hospital bed tax this year started in the senate which is unconstitutional
subject: state-finances,taxes
speaker: david-pennington
justification: the mayor and gubernatorial candidate is correct that tax laws must begin in the house of representatives but because the bill called for a state agency and not lawmakers to levy the fee a legislative law opinion deemed the approval process acceptable also challenges to the bills constitutionality would be difficult because the georgia supreme court has not overturned legislation that has been duly passed by both houses and signed into law pennington and others may not agree with the process or how the hospital levy is classified but the law appears not to be on their side

statement: every child born today inherits a share in a national debt that stands at more than trillion
subject: deficit
speaker: tim-pawlenty
context: his book, "Courage to Stand: An American Story"
justification: on jan gross federal debt stood at just over trillion which works out to for every american so both of the figures pawlenty used have a basis in reality but they do not relate to each other the way he suggested if pawlenty wants to stick with the per person figure he should have said that debt stands at more than trillion alternately if he prefers to stick with the more than trillion debt figure he should say that the amount of debt per person exceeds

statement: a strong bipartisan majority in the house of representatives voted to defund obamacare
subject: congressional-rules,federal-budget,health-care
speaker: ted-cruz
justification: cruz said that a strong bipartisan majority in the house of representatives voted to defund obamacare even if you consider the overall margin to be a strong victory for backers of the measure it doesnt qualify as bipartisan except in the most hyper technical sense two democrats out of the who voted barely more than percent of the partys caucus joined republicans in voting for the bill in our book that doesnt qualify as much of a bipartisan action

statement: proximity to high voltage power lines lowers property values by as much as percent
subject: energy,environment,housing,recreation
speaker: friends-india-point-park
justification: riley says that language was chosen on purpose theres also some question about what the group means by proximity but we wont get into that here

statement: what the facts say is the best scenario for kids is a loving mom and dad
subject: children,diversity
speaker: reince-priebus
justification: priebus said what the facts say is the best scenario for kids is a loving mom and dad as opposed to having same sex parents and overall scholarly research shows that what matters to children is the quality and stability of the parenting rather than the parents particular sex gender or sexual orientation

statement: says mark neumann nancy pelosi
subject: federal-budget,infrastructure,message-machine,transportation,voting-record
speaker: scott-walker
justification: using walkers logic walker could have linked himself to pelosi after all he supported a provision in the bill at the time walker wouldnt agree with that comparison and we dont agree with the neumann pelosi one

statement: to hear gov christie tell it everything in new jersey is going just fine well i see another new jersey with unemployed one of the worst jobless rates in the country working and middle class families have seen costs soar from property taxes to college tuition
subject: education,jobs,taxes
speaker: barbara-buono
justification: christie tell it everything in new jersey is going just fine well i see another new jersey with unemployed one of the worst jobless rates in the country working and middle class families have seen costs soar from property taxes to college tuition buono is right that nearly new jerseyans are out of work but fewer people are unemployed now than when christie became governor also the state is faring better in job creation when employment gains are analyzed across the bulk of christies time in office still the governors aid cuts in to help close budget gaps resulted in higher tuition at two year and four year schools in the state

statement: says delegates cant legally change the republican national convention rules to prevent donald trumps nomination
subject: corrections-and-updates,elections,legal-issues
speaker: donald-trump
justification: trump said delegates seeking to change the convention rules to prevent his nomination cant do it legally under current rules the delegates are bound to vote for whomever won their states primary or caucus in most cases trump but if this years rules committee votes to change the rules to thwart trump its well within its authority to do so and intervention by the courts would be unlikely because political parties are private organizations courts have said they can set their own rules

statement: rebuilding three high schools will benefit percent of portland public school students
subject: education
speaker: carole-smith
justification: but we dont agree with the way smith reached her number by using clusters and we dont think lincoln should be included when none of lincoln will be rebuilt by the proposed bond measure the school districts own projections show enrollment at the three rebuilt high schools will make up only a quarter of all high school students

statement: proposition on novembers texas ballot does not cost state taxpayers any money
subject: elections,water
speaker: H204TEXAS-PAC
justification: she added that the proposal does not encumber any state funds and while the additional bond authority sought in the proposition would not cost state taxpayers up front state lawmakers could still exploit their standing authority as before to spend state revenue on related debt

statement: providence has the lowest crime rate in three decades
subject: crime,job-accomplishments
speaker: david-cicilline
justification: for example cicilline is talking about the crime rate when the number his administration is using is the total number of crime reports which is different but when we looked closely we found that those issues didn t actually affect the conclusion for a discussion of those factors click here

statement: on banning earmarks
subject: federal-budget
speaker: bill-nelson
justification: going forward sen nelson will keep looking for ways to cut spending while also fighting to make sure florida gets its fair share of federal funding for things like ports military bases and major projects that bring new jobs without a formal ban nelson who is up for reelection in is free to continue to pursue earmarks but his nov vote is an about face from an earlier vote and his comments to reporters

statement: says hes taken an pay decrease in each of the nine years he has been in office
subject: candidates-biography,county-budget,county-government
speaker: gerald-daugherty
justification: daugherty says on his campaign site that hes taken an pay decrease in each of the nine years he has been in office as a commissioner daugherty took a pay cut once in fiscal his salary went down percent to daugherty also hasconsistently taken steps to ensure hes paid percent less than fellow commissioners each year though in one year his pay ran about percent behind

statement: percent of americans are millionaires percent of house reps are millionaires percent of senators are millionaires
subject: occupy-wall-street
speaker: facebook-posts
justification: the facebook posting from occupy d c said percent of americans are millionaires percent of house reps are millionaires percent of senators are millionaires one recent study found that around percent of all u s households have net assets of more than million it s closer if you look only at income the top percent of americans has an average income of million but the relevant figure would be net worth as for members of congress the most recent estimate shows that percent of house members and percent of senators are millionaires in net worth that means the facebook post is a bit high in its estimate of house millionaires and a bit low in its estimate of senate millionaires the numbers support the underlying point of the facebook post that members of congress are disproportionately wealthy but not on the scale suggested

statement: the decision for the united states to buy heavy water from iran will directly subsidize irans nuclear program
subject: energy,foreign-policy,nuclear
speaker: paul-ryan
justification: heavy water which can be used to make a nuclear weapon clearly is part of irans nuclear program and by reducing irans heavy water stockpile the purchase helps iran comply with a nuclear agreement that is aimed at making it harder for the country to develop a nuclear weapon

statement: the texas department of transportation misplaced a billion dollars
subject: transportation
speaker: debra-medina
justification: the money never existed in the first place but she didn t miss the point

statement: a judges order means theres a constitution exemption zone if you live within miles of the united states border
subject: civil-rights,immigration,privacy,technology
speaker: facebook-posts
justification: a facebook post said a judge s order means there s a constitution exemption zone if you live within miles of the united states border there is a border search exception which long predates the district court ruling that allows officials at or near borders to search people and their possessions without obtaining warrants experts say thats not an exception to the whole fourth amendment it s certainly not an exemption to the entire constitution which covers a wide range of rights like freedom of the press and freedom of religion

statement: pepper kicked off a jock tax imposing a levy on the sports and entertainment industry
subject: message-machine,taxes
speaker: dave-yost
justification: the story did not mention pepper or the city of cincinnati however peppers legislation while beneficial to the city budget did institute the tax collection in cincinnati and the experts we talked to said collecting the tax was the citys prerogative pepper cant duck responsibility for starting the tax in cincinnati

statement: mitch mcconnell opposed legislation to create and protect kentucky jobs help for the unemployed health care for kentucky s children and fair pay for women
subject: economy,health-care,workers
speaker: democratic-national-committee
justification: actually mcconnell said he supported all of those values but he didn t agree with democratic methods for achieving them

statement: under mayor tom barrett the number of milwaukee police officers has not increased
subject: city-budget,crime,job-accomplishments
speaker: bob-donovan
justification: the mayor will propose his budget in september our rating donovan said the number of milwaukee police officers has not increased under mayor tom barrett and other measuring sticks offered by barretts office show the same trend

statement: taxpayers subsidize percent of each marta trip
subject: transportation
speaker: brett-bittner
job: Executive Director, Libertarian Party of Geo
justification: i didnt use the ancillary figures in the budget he said were still subsidizing over half as taxpayers especially those of us who live and work in fulton and dekalb in rebuttal harris points out every mode of transportation including road building is subsidized by taxes to some extent that argument aside bittner was significantly off in assigning percent of the costs of a marta trip to the taxpayer even if he stands by the larger point

statement: president obama sen harry reid and rep nancy pelosi passed a trillion stimulus bill
subject: stimulus
speaker: george-allen
justification: it roughly equals the total year expenses of virginias state government between and allen is not only exaggerating the spending total by president obama and the democratic leaders of congress he is doing it by including billions of dollars passed under a republican president so we have to set the meter ablaze

statement: says people in africa literally walk two and three hundred miles in order to vote
subject: elections
speaker: mike-bennett
context: comments made on the Senate floor.
justification: none of the african elections officials we spoke with heard of any case of someone walking to miles to vote in fact they wanted to know where bennett got his information from we searched news accounts of the recent elections in chad uganda nigeria and elsewhere and found no instance of people walking hundreds of miles in order to vote

statement: before world war ii very few people actually had health insurance
subject: health-care,public-health
speaker: james-carr
job: manager of business operations at a community hospital
justification: carr said before world war ii very few people had health insurance while carr doesnt take into account the advances in medical care over the past years hes right only about percent of the u s population had private health insurance then generally from an employer based system

statement: half of children struck by cars near schools are hit by parents driving children to school
subject: transportation
speaker: safe-routes-schools
justification: were not suggesting that proponents of safer roads have trumped up a figure to champion a cause

statement: citizens property insurance has over billion worth of risk with less than billion worth of surplus
subject: state-budget,weather
speaker: rick-scott
justification: scott has said repeatedly that citizens has more than billion worth of risk but about billion in cash surplus but the billion number vastly overstates what citizens might have to pay in even the most vicious storm season imaginable so those numbers are not the appropriate figures to use when determining whether the insurer is going to be able to pay the bill after a storm scotts statement ignores critical facts that would give a different impression

statement: tom leppert pledged to make dallas a sanctuary city for illegal immigrants
subject: immigration
speaker: conservative-renewal-pac
justification: we were hampered by not being offered or finding the original described pledge still leppert s camp confirmed that he at one time pledged respect for immigration enforcement being a federal issue if so our sense is that he acted in step with the police departments decade old policy of leaving immigration related inquiries to uncle sam which alone can be taken as sufficient to support the sanctuary city label then again leppert did not pledge to make dallas into a sanctuary his position was essentially status quo also the county joined the secure communities program while he was mayor

statement: putting three republicans in my cabinet is unprecedented
subject: history
speaker: barack-obama
justification: it d be one thing if obama had appointed the republican leader of the senate to a high level cabinet position that might move things toward some sort of reconciliation government he said but governing is way more sophisticated than these symbolic gestures whatever you make of the appointments obama is on solid ground when he said his three republican cabinet appointments were unprecedented

statement: from to the top percent saw their income go up by roughly percent while the median wage in the country over the same years went up percent
subject: economy,history,income,pundits,taxes
speaker: rachel-maddow
justification: the median wage in the country expressed in constant dollars does appear to be in the range maddow cited though with statistics broken out separately for men and women we can t be precise it s not unreasonable to cite those numbers but the economists we spoke to preferred to use figures that included capital gains which show the top percent saw an increase of percent either way maddow s point that the s were much more of a boon for the very rich than everyone else is valid

statement: i am very proud as governor of florida that we signed the first divestment act as it relates to iran divesting any investments in companies that would invest in iran
subject: florida,foreign-policy
speaker: charlie-crist
context: a U.S. Senate debate on CNNs State of the Union.
justification: arnold schwarzenegger signed a related bill prohibiting the states pension funds from investing in companies doing business in iran he said florida signed the first divestment act concerning companies doing business with iran media reports and official pronouncements support crists story

statement: as a result of climate change ice fishermen in wisconsin are already noticing fewer days they can be out on our ice covered lakes
subject: climate-change,environment
speaker: mark-pocan
justification: not what is going to happen this year our rating its been a longer and colder winter than in recent years but that doesnt erase a trend thats been well established the number of days that the lakes have ice on them making them safe for ice fishing has declined

statement: muslim nations did not call out the people who celebrated the attacks
subject: islam,terrorism
speaker: bill-oreilly
context: a broadcast of Fox News' "The O'Reilly Factor"
justification: oreilly said that muslim nations did not call out the people who celebrated the attacks so far as we can tell there was no official condemnation of people celebrating the attacks however muslim governments and religious leaders condemned the attacks themselves as did many average muslims oreillys statement is accurate as far as it goes but it leaves out important information that might lead someone to reach a different conclusion

statement: says donald trump said of women and you can tell them to go f themselves
subject: women
speaker: priorities-usa-action
justification: priorities usa in an anti trump ad quotes the candidate as saying and you can tell them to go bleep themselves it comes after multiple comments critical of women the super pac says the sound clip wasn t meant to be taken as a reference to women that as trump might say is a huuuuuuuge stretch the ad is all about women it features seven women and two men only one of whom has a speaking role all of the mouthed phrases except the one in question clearly attack criticize or make disturbing references to women the ad offers no indication that the f themselves line refers to anything but women in fact it refers to businesses that left the united states

statement: the taliban has been there for years and years i mean hundreds of thousands of years
subject: afghanistan,terrorism
speaker: kendrick-meek
justification: meek clearly made a mid debate stumble he could have just stopped after saying that the taliban has been there for years and years rather than adding i mean hundreds of thousands of years

statement: iran president hassan rouhani has more cabinet members with ph d s from american universities than members of barack obamas cabinet
subject: education,foreign-policy
speaker: bob-schieffer
job: Host of CBS' Face the Nation
context: comments at a forum at the Center for Strategic and International Studies
justification: bob schieffer referenced an atlantic piece when he said rouhanis cabinet has more members with ph d s from american universities than obamas while we could not nail down the academic background of each member of irans cabinet we found enough members with verifiable degrees three to deem his statement accurate obama has two including one official with cabinet rank what it all means for international relations remains to be seen

statement: the words subhuman mongrel which ted nugent called president barack obama were used by the nazis to justify the genocide of the jewish community
subject: history
speaker: wolf-blitzer
justification: blitzer said the words subhuman mongrel were used by the nazis to justify the genocide of the jewish community

statement: barack obama says hes going to reduce the long term debt and deficit by trillion doesnt say how hes going to do it
subject: debt,deficit
speaker: chris-christie
context: an interview on NBCs Meet The Press
justification: but the president has outlined in extensive detail how he would achieve more than trillion in deficit reduction over the next decade

statement: birth control pioneer margaret sanger wasan active participant in the ku klux klan
subject: abortion
speaker: william-obrien
job: Speaker of the House of Representatives
justification: former new hampshire speaker of the house william obrien wrote that margaret sanger was the founder of planned parenthood and an active participant in the klu klux klan birth control advocate sanger did give a speech to a womens branch of the kkk and she was a believer in eugenics

statement: says president obama and his national labor relations board sued boeing over its decision to open a plant in south carolina
subject: economy,jobs,market-regulation
speaker: nikki-haley
context: a speech at the Republican convention
justification: haley said obama and his national labor relations board sued boeing over its decision to open a plant in south carolina this oversimplifies a complex set of practices and relationships the practices of the nlrb keep it many steps away from the president in keeping with that process the board members themselves did not take any action regarding boeing obamas greatest influence on the nlrb in this case can be found in his temporary appointment of the nlrb general counsel the counsel decided to bring the case before an administrative judge haley refers to the government suing whereas the process is best described as a hearing in which the nlrb represents the interests of the party making the complaint

statement: says u s sen ron johnson led the fight to let polluters release unlimited amounts of carbon pollution and took nearly from polluters
subject: environment,government-regulation
speaker: league-conservation-voters
justification: much of the ads content is recycled

statement: orrin hatch co sponsored a health care bill that had an individual mandate
subject: health-care,pundits
speaker: cenk-uygur
justification: durenberger said that it was republicans who had changed in the years since backing away from policies on health care they once supported uygur asked did you know that hatch co sponsored the bill that had an individual mandate we didn t but we checked the record hatch was the co sponsor of a republican backed bill that included an individual mandate

statement: more student athletes graduate than the students who arent student athletes
subject: education,sports
speaker: mark-emmert
justification: emmert said more student athletes graduate than the students who arent student athletes experts the government and the ncaa dont agree on how this data should be calculated but the best and most recent measurement we have for drawing a comparison shows that the graduation rate among division i student athletes is about the same as the general student body though it is higher for division ii and division ii but the graduation rates are not the same across all sports divisions schools or demographics so a group with a particularly good or bad graduation rate could skew the overall results

statement: u s rep lloyd doggett is the most liberal man in the united states congress
subject: bipartisanship,candidates-biography
speaker: donna-campbell
justification: the point i was making is that mr doggetts ideology is considerably more liberal than mine and considerably more liberal than what many many central texans are telling me they want to see in their u s representative so how does the doctors convention charge stick doggett is liberal but hes by no measure the most liberal member of congress voting analyses show campbell owned up after we followed up

statement: its entirely possible that the democratic nominee hillary clinton earned more money giving a single speech on wall street than i made the six years that i was there back in the s in fact its quite likely
subject: income
speaker: pat-toomey
context: an interview with Chris Stigall on Talk Radio 1210 WPHT
justification: pat toomey said that it was possible and even likely that hillary clinton earned more money giving a single speech to a wall street bank than he did in his six years there clinton earned in her most profitable speech to a wall street bank so toomey would have had to have earned an average of about per year on wall street its possible the entry level salary for a trader was less than in the s but toomey was a trader at the forefront of the derivatives operation at morgan grenfell so its likely he earned a significant bonus which would put his earnings over that threshold it gets less likely if we adjust toomeys non bonus inflated potential salary for inflation an annual salary of about in would make significantly more than over six years in dollars and toomey didnt just say it was possible he made less in six years on wall street than clinton did in one speech he said it was likely based on average salaries and bonuses from this era of wall street and input from experts it does not seem likely it gets less likely if we adjust toomeys non bonus inflated potential salary for inflation an annual salary of about in would make significantly more than over six years in dollars

statement: says mitt romney flip flopped on an assault weapons ban
subject: guns,message-machine-2012
speaker: democratic-national-committee
justification: the dnc ad has some problems it uses some deceptive editing and it ignores the fact that romney was pretty consistent in both of the comments to frame his support for an assault weapons ban in the context of a compromise that also expanded other types of gun rights the difficulty of analyzing this charge is that romney s position on an assault weapons ban in the debate was so muddled that it s hard to pin down whether he actually flip flopped it s more an example of an internal inconsistency than a flip flop per se in fact the dnc might have made a more convincing argument simply by quoting the confilcting parts of romneys debate comment so the dnc made some procedural missteps but it s on to something about romney s delicate dance on gun control

statement: says state senate president stephen sweeney gave us the nations highest income tax rates driving out jobs
subject: income,jobs,message-machine-2012,taxes
speaker: americans-prosperity-new-jersey
context: a television ad posted on YouTube
justification: the new jersey chapter of americans for prosperity launched an ad campaign targeting democratic incumbents running for re election one television spot said sweeney gave us the nation s highest income tax rates driving out jobs during sweeneys tenure the top income tax rate in new jersey increased twice neither of those tax hikes bumped new jersey into the top spot in the nation for income taxes and you cant solely blame sweeney for either increase and the ads larger point that high incomes tax rates decreased jobs is overstated

statement: delaware democratic senate candidate chris coons thought that a call should be taxed
subject: message-machine,public-safety,taxes,technology
speaker: christine-odonnell
justification: yes he proposed a tax but for a service on which other phones already were being taxed and coons most certainly did not propose taxing individual calls

statement: when tim kaine was governor spending soared blowing holes in the budget every year
subject: job-accomplishments,message-machine-2012,state-budget,state-finances
speaker: crossroads-gps
justification: crossroads said when tim kaine was governor spending soared blowing holes in the budget every year did spending soar under kaine the total state budget went up by billion during kaines term representing an percent increase increase in raw dollars and percent rise adjusted for inflation kaine had little control over the growth which was largely the result of increases in federal grants college tuition and fees charged by state hospitals overall spending did increase under kaine whether it soared is a matter of opinion the total budget under kaine increased at half the average rate of the six governors who preceded him did spending growth cause the shortfalls all of the budget growth occurred in the non general fund and were largely the result of actions by the federal government and state universities all of the shortfalls occurred in the general fund that depends on a separate set of revenues to pay for public education public safety and health programs lower than expected receipts from virginias sales and income taxes blew holes in the general fund a blight that afflicted all but a few states at the end of the recession virginias general fund decreased during kaines term but crossroads fails to establish a critical link between the spending increase and the revenue deficits

statement: president obama has the lowest public approval ratings of any president in modern times
subject: history,polls
speaker: michele-bachmann
context: a Republican presidential debate in Orlando
justification: here is a list of each presidents low point during that time frame john f kennedy percent dwight eisenhower percent george h w bush percent george w bush percent richard nixon percent lyndon b johnson percent barack obama percent bill clinton percent gerald ford percent ronald reagan percent harry truman percent jimmy carter percent by this measure five presidents had lows that were worse than obama at this point in their presidencies so bachmann is far off either way

statement: neville chamberlain told the british people accept the nazis yes they will dominate the continent of europe but that is not our problem lets appease them why because it cant be done we cannot possibly stand against them
subject: health-care,history
speaker: ted-cruz
context: speech advocating repeal of Obamacare law
justification: cruz said chamberlain told the british people accept the nazis yes they will dominate the continent of europe but that is not our problem because it can t be done but he simultaneously committed to british rearmament and also made it clear publicly that his nation would not sit back should germany invade poland

statement: on an income cap for recipients of the popular hope scholarship
subject: education
speaker: jason-carter
justification: but he dismissed the idea of an income cap calling it too blunt an instrument the magazine reported carter spokesman bryan thomas said carter first discussed abandoning the idea of an income cap with students at the university of georgia about a year ago brian robinson a spokesman for deal said carter was late to the game its literally taken jason carter three and a half years to realize you cannot pay for everybody a conclusion that responsible republicans and democrats reached when they took courageous votes to save hope from bankruptcy

statement: wisconsin is dead last in the midwest for job creation
subject: government-regulation,job-accomplishments,jobs,labor,unions,workers
speaker: mark-pocan
justification: our rating pocan said wisconsin is dead last in the midwest for job creation among midwestern states in terms of percentage growth in private sector jobs the latest figures show wisconsin is tied for ninth so not quite dead last

statement: on running a civil and polite campaign
subject: message-machine,campaign-advertising
speaker: roy-barnes
justification: newspapers deal might be considered negative by deal s camp but it stuck to legitimate issues that is verging on what i think most people would be calling a negative ad lau said barnes ads are not nearly as nasty as those in the republican gubernatorial runoff but with each new tv commercial he has moved further from civil and polite territory

statement: says president barack obama has taken days of vacation since he was sworn in compared to for president george w bush at the same point in his presidency
subject: bush-administration,pundits,recreation
speaker: al-sharpton
context: a segment of his MSNBC show, "Politics Nation"
justification: sharpton said that obama has taken days of vacation since he was sworn in compared to for president george w bush at the same point in his presidency while this discrepancy is explained by the fact that bush often worked from a family home in texas whereas obama has no equivalent family retreat sharpton has correctly cited data from the leading authority cbs news mark knoller

statement: the federal government reviewed and verified his administrations numbers showing wisconsin added jobs in
subject: economy,job-accomplishments,jobs
speaker: scott-walker
justification: wisconsin by contrast put its numbers out and walker immediately put them in campaign tv ads before bls had verified them but his statement leaves out the fact federal officials publicly will not verify the numbers and the fact that the emails released do not contain any numbers let alone the ones cited

statement: tom suozzi raised taxes by hundreds of millions of dollars as nassau county executive
subject: taxes
speaker: national-republican-congressional-committee
context: a blog post on the NRCC website
justification: two years after suozzi lost the county executives office the state took control of the countys finances again our ruling the national republican congressional committee said in an online post that former nassau county executive tom suozzi raised taxes by hundreds of millions of dollars during his time in office suozzi raised taxes by more than million by collecting more in property taxes and instituting an energy use tax the million collected from the short lived energy use tax combined with the million increasein property taxes brings the total above that threshold

statement: john holdren director of the white house office of science and technology policy has proposed forcing abortions and putting sterilants in the drinking water to control population
subject: abortion,pundits
speaker: glenn-beck
justification: but in seeking to score points for a political argument beck seriously mischaracterizes holdren s positions holdren didn t advocate those ideas then and when asked at a senate confirmation hearing holdren said he did not support them now we think it s irresponsible to pluck a few lines from a page year old textbook and then present them out of context to dismiss holdren s long and distinguished career

statement: mitt romney drove to canada with the family dog seamus strapped to the roof of the car
subject: animals,candidates-biography,pundits
speaker: gail-collins
job: Columnist for the New York Times
justification: it s important to note that the dog was not literally strapped to the car as in tied around its midsection rather seamus was in a carrier with a protective windscreen that romney had built the dog s diarrhea might indicate that something was amiss but romney s family didn t seem bothered by it

statement: many of the founding fathers were very actively involved in cockfighting
subject: animals,history
speaker: matt-bevin
justification: bevin said that many of the founding fathers were very actively involved in cockfighting in looking at the most prominent founders we found no indications that any of the founders were avid and frequent participants

statement: says state sen sheila harsdorf wants to eliminate medicare as we know it
subject: medicare,retirement
speaker: shelly-moore
justification: we could find no backup at all in our own search of harsdorfs position and she said simply shes focused on state issues indeed the campaign literature highlights a woman who wouldnt be affected and who herself disputes that she cant afford for medicare to end

statement: the majority of people travelling to these destination resorts are not going for the primary purpose of gambling
subject: gambling
speaker: frank-fahrenkopf
job: Retired president and CEO of the American Gaming Association
context: an opinion piece in the "Miami Herald"
justification: fahrenkopf said that the majority of people traveling to destination resorts are not going primarily to gamble he said he based this on a study done by the las vegas convention and visitors authority which showed that most visitors said they came to las vegas for vacation or pleasure first the survey applied only to las vegas to say that its findings apply to all resorts regardless of location seems like a stretch second people may have chosen to visit las vegas for vacation or pleasure primarily because it had gambling the survey didn t press people for more details on their answers so we can t know for sure meanwhile a report from the american gaming association showed that most people percent who frequent casinos across the country always or almost always gamble also florida casinos tend to draw from the local population whether florida could draw visitors in the same way las vegas does remains to be seen fahrenkopf has a point that people who travel to destination resorts may have other things in mind besides gambling

statement: says bill nelson voted percent of the time with barack obama
subject: voting-record
speaker: connie-mack
justification: the campaign backs that figure up with congressional quarterly data from and the figure by itself however doesnt tell the entire story the fact is most democrats and republicans largely vote with their respective party

statement: i did not i did not i do not say that i do not say that climate change is a hoax perpetrated by the chinese
subject: candidates-biography,china,climate-change,economy,energy,environment,history,science
speaker: donald-trump
justification: trump said i did not i did not i do not say that i do not say that climate change is a hoax perpetrated by the chinese he certainly did say it in a tweet four years ago while he has since described that remark as a joke trump has repeatedly called climate change a hoax in speeches tweets and media appearances and he has said as recently as jan that action on climate change is done for the benefit of china

statement: in florida we have on a waiting list for child care and on waiting lists for community care for the elderly
subject: children,education,state-budget
speaker: nan-rich
justification: rich said in florida we have on a waiting list for child care and on waiting lists for community care for the elderly richs numbers on the waiting lists for child care and community care for the elderly were about a year outdated her number overstated the child care waiting list by about and understated the community care for the elderly waiting list by about based on numbers from this summer still her numbers track with recent averages both waiting lists require some further explanation everyone on the list may not be eligible for that particular program or could be moved into another program

statement: says nfl commissioner roger goodell interviewed domestic abuse victim janay rice with ray rice present and for every domestic violence agency every law enforcement agency thats a no no
subject: criminal-justice,sports
speaker: mike-wise
context: comments on CNN's "State of the Union"
justification: wise has a problem with goodell meeting with ray and janay rice together as goodell sought information about the february elevator incident and aftermath that would inform rices discipline by the league first theres little debate that the meeting occurred as it has been widely reported and not challenged by the nfl thats for the most part correct as well though experts we spoke to questioned whether its the right parallel to draw questioning victims separately from suspects in domestic violence cases does appear to be a widespread practice both encouraged by domestic violence advocates and many police and state policies after an incident occurs but goodell was not conducting a criminal investigation that already had occurred and he had access to that information also there are occasions when couples involved in domestic violence cases are interviewed together later allowing police and prosecutors to judge how they act with one another so they can assess credibility and potential prosecution one expert told us

statement: i can tell you that the enhanced interrogation techniques that have since been banned by this administration specifically waterboarding work
subject: afghanistan,bush-administration,candidates-biography,ethics,foreign-policy,homeland-security,human-rights,iraq,public-safety,terrorism
speaker: todd-wilcox
justification: wilcox said i can tell you that the enhanced interrogation techniques that have since been banned by this administration specifically waterboarding work experts said there are few historical accounts of success and even those are suspect meanwhile theres scientific proof that a technique like waterboarding would affect brain function enough to make any prisoners statements unreliable they may say anything to make the waterboarding stop and could actually be physically unable to provide any cogent intelligence wilcox didnt provide concrete proof and experts say virtually none exists

statement: virginia has made no progress on jobs since bob mcdonnell took office
subject: jobs,message-machine-2012
speaker: democratic-party-virginia
justification: to sum up the state democratic party said there has been no progress on creating jobs since mcdonnell took office while the dems are correct that the percentage of the states working age population with a job was the same in june as it was when mcdonnell took office there is no getting around the fact that the state added jobs or that the unemployment rate has dropped during his term that it contradicts the democrats blanket assertion that there has been no progress

statement: the iraq study group reported that saddam hussein had designs on reviving his nuclear program
subject: iraq
speaker: fred-thompson
justification: in december the group released its report the way forward a new approach which recommended a new u s strategy the page report focused on the future of iraq and did not address whether saddam wanted to restart a nuclear program it s possible that thompson was referring to the iraq survey group a cia panel that was formed to investigate whether there were weapons of mass destruction or the intent to produce wmds in saddam hussein s iraq

statement: the sex offender registry has been around for a long time and the research thats out there says that it has no positive impact on the public safety
subject: crime
speaker: ohio-public-defenders-office
justification: what conclusion can we draw about borrors statement for the ohio public defenders office that research shows the sex offender registry has no positive impact we found that research has been done generally on the effectiveness of sex offender registration and notification laws we found that studies indicate the laws have no clear effect on recidivism or repeat offenses which is their intended target and are ineffective in assessing and managing risk although there is some indication that registration and community notification may deter first time adult offenders the studies find that the deterrence doesnt extend to juveniles and that community notification likely increases repeat sex crimes and other crimes

statement: ronald reagan raised the national debt times
subject: deficit
speaker: jim-webb
justification: kogan a former senior adviser to the office of management and budget said its a semantic question as to whether the july should be considered its own increase but added he personally would consider it a second debt ceiling hike our ruling webb said reagan signed off times on increasing the national debt figures from the office of management and budget do show laws were signed to increase the debt limit during reagans eight years in office a semantic argument can be made that the actual debt limit was raised only times during the reagan administration but we dont think its worth the haggle

statement: on whether global warming is man made
subject: climate-change,environment
speaker: sarah-palin
justification: i m not an al gore doom and gloom environmentalist blaming the changes in our climate on human activity palin said monday but i m not going to put my head in the sand and pretend there aren t changes those are two clear statements that palin didn t believe that human activity contributed to global warming she agreed that global warming was real but implied that it had non human causes in her interview with gibson she said that man s activities certainly can be contributing

statement: the number of inmates since on death row dying of natural causes has now surpassed the number of inmates executed
subject: crime,legal-issues
speaker: dean-cannon
justification: but here we re focusing on cannon s call for reforms based on death row inmate data he said the number of inmates since on death row dying of natural causes has now surpassed the number of inmates executed of the death row inmates to die since jan only actually were executed

statement: quite frankly it was during the bush years of spending multiplied now by the obama years that we have this mess
subject: bipartisanship,debt,deficit,federal-budget
speaker: steve-latourette
job: Former U.S. representative from Ohio's 11th District
context: an interview on Fox News Sunday
justification: latourette is correct that the federal budget was balanced in the s at a time when a democratic president was forced to find common ground with republicans who controlled congress hes also correct that the nations budget woes have escalated since then spending is no doubt a major factor but there are a variety of reasons

statement: republicans have proposed dozens of health care solutions designed to help control costs and improve quality
subject: health-care
speaker: ron-johnson
justification: johnson said republicans have proposed dozens of solutions designed to help control costs and improve quality of health care in the united states republicans have circulated quite a few bills and ideas over the years but there is almost nothing in most of the gop proposals that directly addresses quality of care as far as costs most of the proposals have winners and losers some of the bills would make health care more affordable for certain individuals and tort reform and the expansion of health savings accounts could bend the cost curve down slightly

statement: when the union says i want to eliminate tenure thats not true
subject: education,state-budget,unions
speaker: chris-christie
context: a speech at the Harvard Graduate School of Education
justification: the only agreement is that christies proposal eliminates tenure as it is now defined in new jersey some said it s reasonable to call that a form of tenure while others said the word doesn t apply any more the governor said his plan doesn t eliminate tenure

statement: says hillary clinton has donated every cent shes ever earned from speaking fees to charity
subject: candidates-biography
speaker: occupy-democrats
justification: thats a misreading of clintons comments in when she said speaking fees at colleges and universities were donated to the clinton foundation clintons financial disclosure form includes speeches in which clinton was compensated directly

statement: charlottes anti discrimination ordinance would have opened all bathrooms to all sexes at all times if it hadnt been overturned
subject: city-government,gays-and-lesbians,government-regulation,public-safety
speaker: dan-forest
justification: forest a vocal opponent of charlottes anti discrimination ordinance said it would have opened all bathrooms to all sexes at all times the ordinance would have applied only to public accommodations and while theres disagreement on what might have happened with bathrooms in public accommodations precedent is on charlottes side

statement: eighty percent of the american people support an approach to federal budget problems that includes revenues and includes cuts
subject: federal-budget,polls,taxes
speaker: barack-obama
justification: getting back to obama s statement he said you have percent of the american people who support a balanced approach eighty percent of the american people support an approach that includes revenues and includes cuts even the best poll doesn t show support quite that high he would more accurately have accounted for the small numbers that support only tax increases or were unsure putting the number at percent but his overall point is correct that polls show most americans support a balanced approach when given a choice between cutting spending or raising taxes

statement: social security has nothing to do with the federal deficit
subject: federal-budget,social-security
speaker: hank-johnson
justification: but the program has run a deficit each year since then and is taking money from its bonds to cover the gap federal officials are also worried about the long term impact of future deficits on the program johnson has a reasonable argument since social security is taking money from its bond interest to pay to cover the current gap but these gaps do have an impact on other parts of the federal budget and the projections are that the problem is going to get worse

statement: about percent of all the gun sellers are responsible for more than half of the guns that are used in crimes
subject: crime,government-regulation,guns
speaker: hillary-clinton
justification: tracing helped establish that a suburban milwaukee gun store was a top seller of crime guns locally for more than a decade our rating clinton said about percent of all the gun sellers are responsible for more than half of the guns that are used in crimes its also worth noting that the traces go back to the original seller of a crime gun and dont take into account whether there were other transactions before a particular gun was used in a crime

statement: on pay for fired milwaukee police officers
subject: state-budget
speaker: alberta-darling
justification: i told robin that he needs to talk with mr tobin darling said on june walker vetoed the provision when he signed the two year budget darling acknowledged she sought a veto of an amendment she co sponsored

statement: texas is the state that has now gone the longest without electing a democrat statewide
subject: elections,history
speaker: joaquin-castro
context: a panel at the Texas Tribune Festival.
justification: texas voters have not elected a democrat to statewide office for longer than voters in any other state

statement: says cnn reported ben carson was taking a break from campaigning and the cruz campaign forwarded that news to our volunteers
subject: candidates-biography
speaker: ted-cruz
justification: cruz said that it was cnn not his campaign that first reported that carson taking a break from campaigning and his campaign forwarded that news to his supporters cruz s campaign took a nugget of information from cnn and took it too far cnn reported that carson was to take a break after iowa while simultaneously noting that carson would ultimately continue campaigning the cruz campaign sent messages on its app anyway saying that carson would stop his campaign a key surrogate said that carson was doing the equivalent of suspending thats more than simply forwarding news

statement: today if you were raised poor youre just as likely to stay poor as you were years ago
subject: families,income,poverty
speaker: paul-ryan
justification: ryan wrote that today if you were raised poor youre just as likely to stay poor as you were years ago

subject: guns
speaker: chain-email
justification: a chain email said president obama told a room of students children every time i clap my hands together a child in america dies from gun violence a child then purportedly told obama he could solve the problem by not clapping anymore

statement: the united states has the longest surviving constitution
subject: foreign-policy,history,new-hampshire-2012
speaker: jon-huntsman
context: a campaign appearance in Milford, N.H.
justification: the u s constitution is the longest surviving constitution in the world still there are other countries that have multiple governing documents that are older than the u s constitution update after this item comparing the longevity of the u s constitution to others around the world appeared two readers noted that the massachusetts state constitution is even older

statement: says in oregon in percent of all pregnancies were unintended
subject: children,families,health-care,women
speaker: carolyn-tomei
justification: politifact oregon rates the accuracy of the statement not the ins and outs of the survey from which the statement comes in the colloquial sense tomei is off by a few points in the survey sense she is backed up by a national study although for a different year we find those two factors are enough to find her statement accurate but needing both clarification and additional information

statement: austin school district teachers are the lowest paid of any urban texas district and the lowest paid of any surrounding school district
subject: education,state-budget,state-finances
speaker: gina-hinojosa
job: President, Austin Independent School District Board of Trustees
context: an interview with Kiah Collier, Austin American-Statesman reporter
justification: hinojosa said austin school district teachers are the lowest paid of any urban texas district and the lowest paid of any surrounding school district hinojosa relied on research not extending to all urban or all nearby districts nor did it roll in teachers with advanced degrees those gaps aside the pay contrasts arent entirely clear cut inexperienced and very experienced austin teachers were paid more in than peers in some or most nearby districts and if you count social security contributions austin teachers in general were compensated better on average than teachers in nearby districts on the other hand all austin district teachers were paid less than counterparts in comparable urban districts across the state even after taking into account social security contributions

statement: says clackamas county has more urban renewal debt than all the other oregon counties combined
subject: county-government
speaker: john-lee
justification: but when we read the statement we thought of clackamas county as a geographic region not as a government entity we think most people would agree with our interpretation

statement: nasa scientists fudged the numbers to make the hottest year to overstate the extent of global warming
subject: climate-change,environment
speaker: steve-doocy
job: Co-host of Fox New Channel's "Fox and Friends"
justification: doocy with fox news said nasa scientists fudged the numbers to overstate the extent of global warming this exaggerated the thrust in the underlying blog post it accused government scientists of altering the u s temperature record not the record for the entire earth as for what the blog said we found that experts across the spectrum found fundamental flaws in its analytic methods by relying on raw data it ignored that the number and location of weather stations and the methods of measuring temperatures across the united states have changed greatly over the past years the experts we reached or whose work we read generally agree that the corrections for flawed data produce valid results the bare bones approach used in the blog post provides no solution to the issues of weaknesses in the raw data

statement: the university of wisconsin system is larger than any business in the state of wisconsin
subject: state-budget
speaker: dale-kooyenga
justification: our rating kooyenga said that the uw system is larger than any business in the state of wisconsin hes right when you consider employment within wisconsin which is the most obvious way to make such a comparison by other measurements such as annual revenue there are many wisconsin based companies that are larger than uw but that creates more of an apples and oranges comparison

statement: there is no record of congresswoman betty sutton ever holding a single in person town hall meeting open to the general public
subject: job-accomplishments
speaker: jim-renacci
justification: to renaccis credit he has held regular town hall meetings with constituents even as hostile videographers have doggedly recorded them and his staff could have argued that they think he meets with constituents more often or that sutton does not hold town hall meetings often enough

statement: mark herring voted to allow sex offenders including rapists to serve shorter sentences
subject: criminal-justice
speaker: mark-obenshain
justification: obenshain said herring voted to allow sex offenders to serve shorter sentences herring voted against a bill that ended the sentencing discretion judges had in rare cases when some sex offenders and a few other types of criminals were convicted on multiple counts herrings vote would not have shortened the prison time faced by sex offenders it merely would have continued the the sentencing procedures in place and obenshain in his broad reference to sex offenders omits the fact that only a tiny percentage of them had circumstances in their cases that allowed for discretion in sentencing

statement: iraq has the second largest oilfields in the world behind saudi arabia
subject: energy,foreign-policy
speaker: donald-trump
context: an interview with Sean Hannity of Fox News
justification: so where does this leave us for the part of the comment in which trump appeared to be talking about the eve of the iraq war hes correct that iraq had the second largest oilfields in the world to saudi arabia but where he flashes forward to a hypothetical near term takeover by iran trumps statistic is off slightly since iraq while still high on the list has been passed by three additional countries

statement: says states mandated tests come from an english company
subject: education
speaker: george-lavender
context: in Texas House of Representatives debate
justification: lavender said the states mandatory tests come from an english company pearson the parent company of texas testing contractor is english then again ncs pearson is incorporated in minnesota and was american owned until also test items are generated by subcontractors including the san antonio division of a global organization headquartered in new jersey

statement: says he got twice as much money from the sale of county grounds land than milwaukee county executive scott walker was willing to accept
subject: job-accomplishments
speaker: lee-holloway
job: Chairman, Milwaukee County Boaerd of Supervisors
context: an interview with a weekly newspaper
justification: million lower that wouldnt be much negotiating at all

statement: we spend in tax loopholes annually trillion thats more than we spend on our defense budget in a year on medicare or medicaid in a year
subject: taxes
speaker: jeanne-shaheen
context: an interview with the editorial board of 'The Telegraph.'
justification: loophole is a very common term used on both sides but i think when people look behind what those expenditures were that s not what comes to mind added chuck marr director of federal tax policy at the center on budget and policy priorities our ruling the official definition aside we think loophole conjures images of a narrow tax break that gives a special and in many cases unfair advantage to a specific constituency but we don t think the entire list of tax deductions exemptions credits fits that definition she s right about the total cost of those expenditures but her definition of loophole is a big stretch

statement: on the bush tax cuts
subject: taxes
speaker: john-mccain
justification: wasteful earmark spending is a disgrace and it caused us to alienate our republican base so these tax cuts need to be made permanent otherwise they would have the effect of tax increases but look if we had gotten spending under control we d be talking about more tax cuts today

statement: over half of the black workers in this country earn less than an hour
subject: diversity,economy,jobs
speaker: bernie-s
context: a Democratic presidential candidates' forum in Rock Hill, S.C.
justification: sanders said that over half of the black workers in this country earn less than an hour depending on the time frame used the data shows that roughly half of black workers earn less than the most recent data shows that half earn less than which is a little higher than what sanders said but his number is not far off

statement: insured floridians pay about for every hospital stay to cover the cost of the uninsured
subject: health-care,medicaid
speaker: florida-chamber-commerce
context: a report on health care costs
justification: the florida chamber of commerce said insured floridians pay about for every hospital stay to cover the cost of the uninsured that number is based on an estimate the chamber developed in house calculating an average based on an unspecified urban hospital using the most recent data theres no way to tell just how accurate that estimate is since it makes plenty of assumptions on actual costs it also doesnt take into account how much the affordable care act will change the data since the requirement for the uninsured to have policies didnt kick in until experts we talked to said there are problems with the chambers number but its a somewhat reasonable illustration to a real problem in florida people who are insured end up paying for those who arent the statement is partially accurate but leaves out important details or takes things out of context

statement: sixteen million jobs were created under ronald reagans presidency
subject: jobs
speaker: newt-gingrich
justification: some argue reagans predecessor jimmy carter was responsible for some economic policies that helped during the reagan years others contend the increase in employed americans were largely a result of the federal reserve cutting interest rates and expanding the money supply policies used after the recent great recession reagans policies many of which required the support of congress deserve some credit for the increase

statement: this would be the largest casino in the united states
subject: gambling
speaker: its-still-bad-idea
justification: especially when they have called a press conference to counter deceptive campaigning by the other side her revised statement that the proposed casino would be the second largest in the country isnt even close to accurate either that shows a reckless disregard for accuracy

statement: barack obama s health care plan will cost taxpayers more to cover each new person
subject: health-care
speaker: hillary-clinton
justification: so clinton s ad is pushing the envelope quite a bit to say that her plan would save per person

statement: barack obama percent of his votes have been solely along party line
subject: candidates-biography
speaker: sarah-palin
justification: by comparison rival sen john mccain has voted with his fellow republicans at an percent clip over the entire bush presidency but as politifact has reported before voting studies can be skewed depending on a lot of factors such as attendance the roll call votes picked and the issues that arise during the course of the year some congressional sessions may have more head to head party line votes than others examining votes that matched the position of president bush the titular head of the gop shows mccain has supported him percent of the time while obama has gone along percent cq found

statement: president obama and nancy pelosi said obamacare would save money because they factored in years worth of tax revenue and only six and half years worth of expenses
subject: health-care
speaker: eric-hovde
justification: there are numerous parts of the bill that have already taken effect

statement: john mccain has not led on nonproliferation issues when he had the chance in the senate
subject: foreign-policy
speaker: barack-obama
context: a statement by campaign spokesman Bill Burton
justification: in mccain was among of republicans who joined with democrats to ratify the chemical weapons convention which banned the development production sale use or stockpiling of chemical weapons and in he voted with the majority of the senate in a tally to ratify the strategic arms reduction treaty which provided for reduction of about one third in the arsenals of long range missiles and bombers of the united states and former soviet union the majority of people following the issue would point out mccain has not taken a leadership role on nonproliferation during his career in the senate said daryl kimball executive director of the washington based arms control association in spite of mccain s moves to the center and his more fleshed out positions on nonproliferation we don t find much in mccain s senate record to refute the charge of the obama camp

statement: says american polling shows russian president vladimir putin has an percent approval rating
subject: polls
speaker: donald-trump
context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
justification: trump said american polling shows russian president vladimir putin has an percent approval rating multiple american polls have found putins approval rating to hover around percent among the russian public including a recent study that aimed to adjust for any possibility that respondents have been lying to pollsters out of fear or social expectations

statement: pasco county schools have graduation rates substantially higher than the state average and dropout rates below the state average
subject: education
speaker: heather-fiorentino
job: superintendent of Pasco County's public schools
justification: fiorentino accurately touts the districts improved dropout rate state reports show the district dropout rate was percent for down from percent in the overall state rates were percent in and percent in so pasco did show better improvement than the state

statement: eighty five percent of the states in the united states that had electrocution have now abolished it
subject: criminal-justice,states
speaker: scott-surovell
justification: academic research shows states have allowed electrocutions since the th century a review of laws today shows that six states may still use their electric chairs at a condemned prisoners request that means percent of the states that had electrocutions have ended the practice surovell is right that states are shutting down their electric chairs but his percentage is slightly off

statement: says that each year about american women become pregnant through rape or incest
subject: abortion,crime
speaker: wendy-davis
justification: davis said each year about american women become pregnant through rape or incest she offered no backup for the incest part of the statement and we found none estimates of rape related pregnancies per year vary from to davis number despite dating from fits inside that range but there is too much disagreement for us or davis to pin any one statistic as the definitive number of rape related pregnancies per year

statement: the fact is the clinton foundation has got about percent in overhead and percent of the money is actually getting into the places it should

statement: secret documents reveal that iran could obtain a nuclear weapon far sooner than we were told and tammy duckworth voted yes on the iran nuclear deal
subject: nuclear

context: an attack video advertisement of Congresswoman Tammy Duckworth
justification: in their anti duckworth campaign ad the independent voice for illinois pac says secret documents reveal that iran could obtain a nuclear weapon far sooner than we were told and tammy duckworth voted yes the advertisement indicates there are multiple documents but according to the associated press story the ad references there is only one secret document the ad also says these secret documents would allow iran to obtain a nuclear weapon sooner than we were told the document explains the secret agreement would boost uranium enrichment capacity but never says iran would be able to obtain a weapon sooner finally an expert told politifact illinois that there is actually no contradiction between the main agreement and the secret document just a bit more detail together these points show a manipulation of the facts ivfi misinterpreted information from the associated press in their advertisement potentially leading people to believe iran will have access to a completed and usable weapon before the deal expires

statement: loranne ausley voted six times to tax your savings
subject: taxes
speaker: republican-party-florida
justification: the statement we re checking in this item is that ausley voted six times to tax your savings ronnie whitaker party executive director called them job killing tax hikes first saying savings is a bit broad the tax didn t touch pensions cds savings accounts and k plans it applied to investments such as stocks bonds and mutual funds second the votes in question weren t for tax hikes they were against cutting the state s intangible tax and there weren t really six of them the rpof actually is talking about three bills and really four votes a vote to lower the intangible tax rate from mill to mill a vote to raise the exemption amounts and then two votes to repeal the tax entirely in each of those cases ausley voted no maybe we re sticklers for words no maybe about it we are but if we use the rpof logic that ausley voted six times to tax your savings we could say quite convincingly that republican u s senate nominee marco rubio voted four times to tax your savings in one year yep back in rubio voted against an amendment offered by democrats that would have increased the amount that could be exempted from the tax but not as much as republicans wanted that same year he cast three other votes in favor of proposals that would have cut the intangible tax in some form or another but not eliminate it altogether by the rpof logic because the tax remained in place rubio cast four votes to tax your savings are we criticizing the republicans in this case
